reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband and 2 year old son for 3 nights and found the stay to be a pleasant one. We booked a suite as we wanted more space for our son, and I was happy to find that the suite had a spacious living room area as well as a very spacious bathroom, consisting of a bathtub, rain shower area and toilet area. We had requested for a baby cot in our booking and while it was not in our room when we checked in, we asked for it again and it was brought in promptly. There was no extra charge for the cot, but it may not be suitable for toddlers or babies who can already flip on their own or crawl, as the mattress is rather high and the railings short - my son could easily hop over the railings to get onto the bed, as we had placed it right at the edge of our bed. It is a wooden cot, but not the sturdiest as there are a lot of screws sticking out and there is a gap from which he could slide out on one end. However, having said that, our son used it without incident and only under constant supervision and with us padding the area around the cot with cushions so that he would not be badly injured even if he were to fall out. The room was spacious enough such that we could still walk around the cot after placing it at the edge of the bed. We found the room and bathroom area to be stylish and modern - who says you have to give up style when travelling with a baby! Our room was the Palm Sugar room and situated in a corner and at one end of the saltwater pool. While it is true that you have to mostly keep the curtains drawn to maintain your privacy, the lights in the room were sufficiently bright and we had no issues with opening the curtains for the living room area while keeping the curtains for the bedroom area drawn. One con of this particular room is that the cleaners' station is right outside the room, and we could hear them laughing and talking for at least 45 min continuously one afternoon when my son was napping, and it isnt conducive if you are a light sleeper and wish to get some rest in the afternoon. One big drawback was the weak wifi signal in the room - we could only connect to the wifi on a very intermittent basis and noticed that most people sat outside their rooms to use their gadgets as there is a wifi base at the pool where the signal is much stronger. Beware of the mosquitoes when you do that though and make sure the mosquito coil is lit at night outside your room! The staff at the hotel are all friendly and helpful, and each one of them speaks very good English. They were all friendly towards my toddler and often stopped to laugh and play with him. We booked our Angkor Wat full day tour with the hotel and got a relatively good guide who did not pressure us or scam us but was instead accommodating of our son. The tour also uses a hotel tuk tuk driver and when we decided to come back to the hotel before lunch to freshen up and to let my son rest before continuing in the evening, neither the guide nor the driver kicked up a fuss and obliged. We were grateful for the flexibility and their obliging attitudes. The hotel even told us to use the tuk tuk driver to head out for lunch as we had already booked him for the whole day. The saltwater pool is a welcome respite from the heat and the temples and while it may be a wee bit deep for children (my 1.8 m husband could not touch the pool floor at one end but the water was probably around 1.3 m on the other end), toddlers and babies can still frolick on the wide steps of the pool quite safely. My husband and I also took turns to try the spa, and while the massages weren't particularly outstanding, the service was warm and friendly and there is a 30% discount during a certain period of time (10 - 3pm if I am not wrong) which results in very reasonable prices. I also liked that they were not queasy serving a pregnant woman (me!) which I have noticed to be the case in many spas in Thailand. As for food, the restaurant has baby chairs, and even provided colouring paper (animal cartoons with fcc logos, so definitely custom printed) and a colour pencil for my son. However, we did found the lunch food to be mediocre and never went back for another meal. Breakfast wasn't too bad (we liked the English sausage and egg muffin, and the toasted banana bread with passion fruit butter) and can be served in room provided that you inform them ahead of time but you can tire of the limited choices after a few days. The hotel is very close to the town centre, and in particular Pub Street (which is the touristy part filled with restaurants, bars and shops) and there will always be tuk tuks waiting outside the hotel to take you to your destination. A one way trip to pub street from the hotel is 2 usd and this seems to be the standard fare as we never paid more than that for the return trip. The hotel is also located just next to the river, and we took a pleasant stroll with our son one morning along the river and he was quite happy to see stone animals such as crocodiles and deer by the riverside. Overall good location, lovely room and premises, baby-friendly service - they just need to work on the Internet connection!
reviews.title: 2 days 1 night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I traveled to Siem Reap with our teenage daughters for a cultural experience and service trip for Caring For Cambodia. We stayed at the FCC based on other friends' suggestions and thoroughly enjoyed it. Everything we asked for (a tray to be removed, a spa appointment to be made, rooms to be made up etc.) happened with the quickest of service...and with a smile. The food at the restaurant was excellent and the ambiance was comfortable and quietly chic. We all used the spa for multiple of services (massages, facials, scalp treatments) and thought the prices and quality services were great. The only "complaint" I would have is they need to improve the manicure/pedicures. Other than that tiny item, everything truly elegant and comfortable. What a bargain for such an environment!
reviews.title: Cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't make a reservation, it's huge c'mon. And after persuading them that we would indeed vacate the reserved table after our beverage we were allowed to sit on the terrace. I chose a Pimms, and was bought a Pimms lireally. It had ice and that was it! Never have I ever seen this. When I queried this with the waitress she said that lemonade was extra. Noooooo problem I don't care I expect to pay for a mixer but straight up Pimms and no lemonade let alone garnish is unacceptable. It duely returneth to my table with said lemonade and a skewer of cucumber.

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel and restaurant is superb..The garden room was beautifully designed and well appointed, with comfortable bedding, We ate in the restaurant three times, twice a la carte and on Saturday night the Cambodian buffet. Everything we ate was delicious, served by attentive staff. The room rate was less than the budget, group hotel we moved from.
reviews.title: fcc do yourself a favour

reviews.text: I only spent one night so could not enjoy all the facilities. Loved the room - would have liked to have a bit more walking space in the room but it was not a big problem. I will certainly return. The pool seemed a bit small so can imagine it may be difficult when there is a lot of people. Food is the best feature at FCC. Great for families too!
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our experience in Cambodia, and we stayed at the Fcc Angkor. This hotel is beautiful and comfortable. Its a great location, good service, and a joy to come back to after a long day of hiking through Angkor temples. There were a few things that I noticed that made the service seem to go the extra mile. Every day at dawn and dusk they would light incense out side the doors of every room to ward off mosquitoes. This was very helpful to keep them from flying into your room. They offer every guest a complimentary foot massage at the spa, which is great after a long day of temple touring. And breakfast can be delivered to your room as early as 4:30. Which is perfect when you are planning to go see the sun rise over Angkor Wat. Over all I would say our stay was perfect. We would definitely go back.
reviews.title: They go the extra mile.

reviews.text: FCC is like a luxury vacation home in Siem Reap. No big wonder there, since it was once the residence of the French Governor. It is located next to the Royal Palace, and right across the tree lined Pokambor Ave. is the slow moving Siem Reap River.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Siem Reap

reviews.text: The hotel is designed with an understated elegance that says you have arrived, without being brash about it. The hotel only has two levels, ground level with most of the rooms encircling the tastefully designed saltwater swimming pool, and a handful of second floor rooms that overlook the pool.
reviews.title: An oasis in the heat

reviews.text: Each room has a foyer with a daybed or sofa. Guests may opt to swim in the pool and use either the pool deck lounging chairs or walk back to their rooms and use their own daybed. The interior of the room is minimally furnished. The beds sit low to the ground, and so do the side tables. There is a writing desk next to the large flat screen TV which is equipped with a modern LED reading light, and a stationary set with postcards and complimentary postage stamps. They even have a stamp pad for use on written correspondence that boldly declares that the writer is in fact, in residence at FCC Angkor.
reviews.title: excellent staff & services, not bad price

reviews.text: Was a great hotel way off the downtown area and away from all the big tourist hotels on the way to the temples. A very quick tut-tut ride to Pub Street and to the Angkor temples. Staff was very accomodating and extremely polite. We used one of the FCC drivers for getting around the temples and was very reasonable and enjoyable getting off the beaten path and away from the tour buses on a few occasions. The breakfast came with the room and was very good way to start the day.
reviews.title: FCC Siem Reap

reviews.text: The FCC is Siem Reap is a lot fancier than its namesake in Phnom Penh. The architecture is quite British and the service was excellent. I had the duck curry in which the curry was great and the duck was ok.
reviews.title: Good Spot to Wind Down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a great range of food and drinks available and regardless of whether you sit inside or out it is a great 'al fresco' feel. A perfect place to relax after a big days checking out the local temples at Angkor Wat.
reviews.title: FCC Angkor - Outstanding Service

reviews.text: We recently stayed here and it is a lovely resort, with great rooms, excellent food and a terrific day spa. The resort was very centrally located and we could not fault it at all. I would like to particularly thank the staff and management at this resort for their exceptional service. I left an expensive ring behind and realised when I got to Phnom Penh the following day. I contacted the resort and explained the situation to the lady at reception and was advised the cleaners had handed it in and she new which one it was. The lady was friendly and helpful and immediately organised to have my ring flown to FCC at Phnom Penh and advised they would contact me when it arrived! Several days later I was contacted and advised that my ring had arrived and was ready for collection. I cannot thank the staff at both resorts enough for assisting me in this matter and I would highly recommend this resort for an indulgent, relaxing and beautiful stay in Siem Reap.
reviews.title: FCC Angkor

reviews.text: Great hotel in terrific location. Rooms, staff, spa, restaurant were all excellent. Great value, highly recommend you consider staying here. The tour packages offered were well organised and professional. The staff were always courteous and helpful and obviously very well trained.
reviews.title: FCC Angkor - Best Value in Siem Reap

description: The FCC Angkor sits at the heart of Siem Reap Town, overlooking the Siem Reap River and just minutes away from Cambodia's most alluring attraction, Angkor Wat.Renovated from the old French Governor's mansion, art deco embraces chic hotel, creating an atmosphere of refined luxury and casual elegance. Defined by its lush green gardens and the salt-water swimming pool, the FCC Angkor embodies Cambodia's tranquil pace of life: a casual swim, drinks in the garden, dinner on the terrace.
